intro: Eupatoriastrum triangulare, commonly known as the triangular eupatoria, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
